attributes.action: Michael Fabricant should be formally sanctioned by Parliament for Islamophobia.
attributes.additional_details: Reported by BBC on 13th July 2018 under heading 'Tory MP Michel Fabricant accused of Islamophobia over Sadiq Khan tweet'.
attributes.background: On 12th July 2018, MP Michael Fabricant tweeted an Islamophobic and offensive tweet depicting Sadiq Khan (London Mayor) being mounted by a pig. He should be formally sanctioned by his fellow MPs in Parliament as bringing Parliament into disrepute and damaging the integrity of the post of MP.

rejection.details:
Complaints about breaches of the House of Commons Code of Conduct are investigated by the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards, who is independent of Parliament and Government. 

You can find out more about the Commissioner and her role here:

http://www.parliament.uk/pcs
